refnamediv.refpurpose: Grey-scale image as a bit-packed array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is a packed grey-scale image format with a depth of 10 bits per pixel. Pixels are stored in a bit-packed array of 10bit bits per pixel, with no padding between them and with the most significant bits coming first from the left.

example.title: V4L2_PIX_FMT_Y10BPACK 4 pixel data stream taking 5 bytes

formalpara.title: Bit-packed representation
formalpara.para:
pixels cross the byte boundary and have a ratio of 5 bytes for each 4 pixels.
Y'00[9:2] Y'00[1:0]Y'01[9:4] Y'01[3:0]Y'02[9:6] Y'02[5:0]Y'03[9:8] Y'03[7:0]
